From the top of the stack trace I can say that this issue could be JEM, GEF or WST fault. 

Since you haven't provided any clue or hint how to reproduce this, it is unclear how it is related to Mylar.
*** Bug 169773 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Well I think it is related to Mylar because:
- when I have the Mylar option Mylar/Context/Manage open editors to match task contextselected and Quit Eclipse with open editors, on restart it will open the ditors and then continuously cycle through all of them, until I quit again.
- Thats why I looked in the error log and selected the one item that contain ed Mylar to submit it as a bug.

I'm using Mac OSK on dual dual core Mac with Java 5.0 My configuration is uploaded as attachment.
I've also voiced this on news.eclips.org.mylar

Maarten

Created an attachment (id=56586)
configuration where bug occurs

The whoel file from eht about/configuration tab.

I think I know how to do a bug report... but I have several times spent many hours to reproduce something that was already known and had a fix or workaround :-(

Here is what I found so far after deactivating most of the (tons of) plugins.
You need eclipse with minimum Mylar and Oxygen XML (http://www.oxygenxml.com/) installed.

IF PRECONDITIONS
one of the files in a context is an XML file opened with Oxygen XML
AND
Mylar has the option "Mylar/Context/Manage open editors to match task context" selected
THEN ON EVENT/ACTION
restoring the context either upon starting Eclipse or de- and re-activating the task in Task List
THIS HAPPENS:
each of the editors will become front most in turn and then deactivate again leading to an endless cycling of front most editor. This stops ONLY if all editor tabs except one are closed.

I've also submitted this bug to SyncRO, makers Oxygen.

I would appreciate pointers to tools or settings I can use to find out more about this problem.

Regards,

Maarten

Maarten: so this happens only with the Oxygen XML editor?  Could you try to make a minimal context (e.g. two interest files) and then try to reproduce it with the Oxygen editor, then the WTP editor (if you have that) and then a plain text editor, and report back?

Also, does that exception happen every time you activate, or every time a file is opened?

(In reply to comment #6)
> Maarten: so this happens only with the Oxygen XML editor?  Could you try to
> make a minimal context (e.g. two interest files) and then try to reproduce it
> with the Oxygen editor, then the WTP editor (if you have that) and then a plain
> text editor, and report back?
> 
> Also, does that exception happen every time you activate, or every time a file
> is opened?
Well my first deduction was wrong. I'm reducing my configuration to something smaller and disable many plugins, but found its not just Oxygen related.
I think it has to do something with activation of a task with a context attached and also stored.
When this happens, nothing appears in the Error Log. Are there any tools like a Context Spy for Mylar that I can use to zoom in?

I have an (almost) identical config on a Pentium Dell laptop and there it never occurs/occured.
So another possibility is that it is Mac Java/SWT or Dual Core/Processor related. I assume that with effectively 4 CPU's, different threads/Jobs are done by different CPU's so maybe rhey can't agree which editor should be frontmost. I will put up the Activity Monitor next time it happens.

What do you think I should investigate first?

Fyi, I'm running Mylar on a Duo too (T2500).  The easiest thing to do now would be to do what Eugene pointed out: check Mylar out, run a runtime workspace, and see if you can get it to happen.  If so, set a breakpoint on something like TaskActivateAction and walk through it.  Note that you can copy your normal workspace and point your runtime workspace at the copy.  Checking our Mylar only takes a few steps:

http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Contributor_Reference#Workspace

Do I need Eclipse 3.3 to develop or can I check out the 3.2 branch into 3.2?
Do I need Aspect J tools?

meanwhile 'debugging by thinking' :
The problem may be related by an interaction between the editor opening and a concurrent action by that event:
- PHPEclipse will try to display the opened file in the PHP Browser AND syntax check it
- Oxygen XML validates the contents of the XML and reports in the Console
Meanwhile Mylar opens another editor from the context and this will result in the cycling
It is definitely something related to Mylar restoring or retrieving a context

You can check out the 3.2 branch in to 3.2.  Prompted by this request, I have just made this easier via project sets: 
  http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Contributor_Reference#Workspace

It could potentially be related to the things you outline, especially to the file being opened on the browser.  If you could check out the sources and provide any additional indication of what's causing it that would be great.

I download the project sets, install Mylar + Bugzilla connector, Replace with version e_3_2_m_1_0, run some tests. OK,
Then launch with some suspected plug ins in new workspace.
Mylar Tasks View won't show!

I just verified by checking out the latest team set for e_3_2_m_1_0 from http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Contributor_Reference#Workspace into a clean workspace, and running.  So chances are that Mylar is failing to start for some reason (e.g. 1.4 VM).  The very first entries in the Error Log of the runtime workbench should indicate what's wrong.  Feel free to attach the error log or paste the exceptions in so that we can help diagnose.

I have sort of done the same: downloaded a clean Calypso, updated everything, re-imported all my favorite plug-ins, but no Eclipse PATCHES!
I have cleaned up my workspace, split in into several smaller ones, one for each major project.
I can download and build the Mylar releases now AND the problem of alternating active editor windows on task activations seems to have gone away because of those steps :-(
So creating a repeatable setting solved the problem...
I already start Eclipse with -clean every time, maybe its time for a -superclean option ;-)

I suggest you close the bug as a WORKSFORME for now. Thank you for your support.

OK, but please reopen if you see this again.  A 3.2-based dev build will be available this Friday, so consider updating to that to see if you can still reproduce.

Fyi, I've made this kind of failure provide a log message with a stack trace instead of an error message.
